Description: Ovoid vase of marl pottery with a flat ledge rim and two pierced cylindrical handles on shoulder; decorated on each side in brown paint with a row of solid triangles and a large Naqada plant with wavy lines below. Wavy lines are painted above and over the handles; below one handle is the skin on pole motif and below the other a row of triangles and a cabin-motif. Two wavy lines divided into 5 segments circle the rim top; on the base is a spiral.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D36h in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery (1921). Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 504
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
